function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Improper handling and disposal of used pipettes and other laboratory equipment may lead to contamination and potential spread of infectious material.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Presence of rt-qpcr inhibition in wastewater samples","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential rt-qpcr contamination during rna extraction and setup","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Sequencing and bioinformatics processes for taqman rt-qpcr products","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of biological samples and reagents in the laboratory increases the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate handling of high-throughput sequencing equipment and reagents can pose a risk of contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of cross-contamination and infection spread during primer sequence removal, read trimming, and data analysis processes.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Incorporating uncertainty and variability in independent variables using a monte carlo approach may introduce errors in the modeling process.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Modeling sars-cov-2 rna copies/l of wastewater as a point estimate with a uniform distribution may lead to underestimation or overestimation of viral load.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Modeling the shedding rate of sars-cov-2 rna copies/g of feces as a log-uniform distribution may introduce variability that impacts the accuracy of infection prevalence estimates.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistent rt-qpcr assay results and detection methods","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rt-qpcr positive samples below quantification level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 rna in untreated wastewater samples","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High sensitivity of infection estimates to sars-cov-2 rna copies in stool and wastewater","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low sensitivity of infection estimates to the daily per capita flow rate of wastewater","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of wastewater samples for early detection of covid-19 may lead to false positives or false negatives due to different assay sensitivities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in assay sensitivity and lod limit of detection may lead to inconsistent results in detecting sars-cov-2 rna in wastewater samples.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of multiple assays with varying sensitivity for detecting sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples may lead to conflicting or inconclusive results.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent results between different assays when concentrations are low","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited information on the effectiveness of virus recovery from wastewater matrices","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High adsorption efficiency of enveloped viruses to electronegative membranes","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Handling sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples increases the risk of exposure to the virus.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective methods for the recovery of sars-cov-2 from wastewater increases the risk of inaccurate data and underestimation of virus presence.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate quantitative estimation of sars-cov-2 in wastewater samples may lead to misinterpretation of the virus prevalence in the community.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viral rna shedding in stool not included in the model, leading to underestimation of prevalence.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty and variation in experimental workflow not accounted for in the model, leading to inaccurate estimations.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited availability of clinical prevalence data for direct comparisons, making it difficult to assess the model’s accuracy.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential exposure to sars-cov-2 and other pathogens during wastewater sampling","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ethical concerns and need for approvals in developing monitoring programs involving community surveillance through wbe","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quantitative predictions from viral rna concentrations in sewage to actual numbers of cases in the community","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Monte carlo simulation estimation of infections in catchment basin","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of rt-qpcr assays for wastewater monitoring","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited personal contact and physical activities due to public health measures can lead to a decline in mental health and well-being","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dissemination of information about the therapeutic effects of physical activities may lead to misinformation or overemphasis on its benefits","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Initial evidence indicating that individuals can maintain and promote mental health through exercise during the pandemic may lead to over-reliance on exercise as a solution to mental health challenges","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Restriction of physical activity for children and adolescents due to covid-19 measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decrease in physical activities and increase in other sedentary activities during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential positive effect of physical activity on mental health during a global pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through physical exercise","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate compliance with preventive guidelines during physical activity","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stress and anxiety leading to non-compliance with preventive measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reduced outdoor activity time and compressed outdoor activity space","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Home-based exercise as a coping strategy during lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of electronic products for human-computer interaction in exergames","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Restriction of indoor and outdoor sports and fitness activities due to control measures like lockdown and quarantine","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Change in types of physical activities due to various factors such as lack of time, space, and increase in family roles","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased awareness of the importance of exercise and immunity during the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced physical activity due to covid-related restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic and financial distress as a barrier to physical exercise","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
